author: arnetheduck
content: This is probably less of a problem than it may seem - the fork choice works with attestations both from the block and from your "local view" of the attestation gossip network - clients are supposed to attest to the head _as soon as it arrives_ and not wait 4 seconds - basically, because the proposer is known, as soon as a "correct" block arrives, you can vote for it and then attestations start building up "stabilising" the fork choice even if those votes are not immediately included in a block.. one could argue that giving attestations more time by increasing the inclusion distance would lead to better attestation packing as well, because now you have more time to aggregate lone stragglers

author: potuz
content: But the strategy for validators will be in this case and wait the maximum possible to see what block is getting voted before submitting their own attestation, which on the limit will be everyone voting for the previous block right at the 16 seconds mark or whatever is the new limit to submit, regardless of whether they saw or not a new block
